intro: Dorstenia barnimiana var. ophioglossoides, commonly known as the "Corky Tree" or "Corky Plant," is a unique member of the Moraceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its thick, corky stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces edible, fleshy fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated as a rare and exotic houseplant.
